name: King Charles III England Coast Path: Mablethorpe to Humber Bridge

ai.summary: A challenging long-distance hike along the England Coast Path from Mablethorpe to the Humber Bridge, covering approximately 180.2 km with dramatic coastal ridges and exposed terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain featuring exposed sea cliffs, dunes, tidal sections, and intermittent ridges. Expect uneven paths, rocky footing, and slippery surfaces near the shore; weather can be windy and changeable with strong coastal currents.
ai.safety_notes: This route includes remote coastal stretches with limited services. Check tide times and forecast weather; avoid cliff edges in high wind or wet conditions. Carry navigation tools (map, compass, or GPS) and a reliable communication method. Plan for multiple days, arrange accommodation or safe campsites, bring ample water and food, and have an emergency plan and means to signal for help.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof boots with good grip
Layered clothing plus a waterproof jacket and pants
Backpack with hydration system or sufficient water (2–3 liters)
Map, compass, and/or GPS with offline download
First aid kit and blister care supplies
High-energy food and snacks for long days
Emergency whistle and a personal locator beacon (PLB) or satellite messenger
Space blanket or lightweight emergency shelter
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offer the most favorable conditions, but coastal weather remains changeable and storms can occur at any time.

seo.title: King Charles III England Coast Path: Mablethorpe to Humber Bridge — 180.2 km Hard Coastal Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore the 180.2 km King Charles III England Coast Path segment from Mablethorpe to Humber Bridge. A hard, coastal-route with ridges, safety tips, and gear recommendations for hikers.
